title: From Op Sindoor to Venezuela: How Chinese weapons, radars keep failing ‚Äî Explained
content: China's arms exports faced a significant setback as its weapons, including air defence systems like the HQ-9 and JY-27A radar, proved ineffective during India's Operation Sindoor and a recent Venezuelan operation. These incidents highlighted a technological gap, with Russian-supplied missiles also failing to perform. The failures have damaged China's reputation as a reliable arms supplier.

title: 'Security issue': B'desh halts visa services in India; bilateral ties reach new low
content: Bangladesh's interim government has temporarily suspended visa services at its key diplomatic missions in India, including New Delhi, citing "security concerns." This move follows similar restrictions by India on Bangladeshi nationals. Dhaka is also seeking a reversal of United States visa bond requirement, deeming it "certainly unfortunate and painful for them."

title: ICE kills woman: Protestors clash with federal agents, 3 held; Minneapolis on edge
content: A woman was fatally shot by an ICE officer in Minneapolis during an immigration crackdown, sparking protests and clashes with law enforcement. State and local officials demanded ICE leave Minnesota, but Homeland Security stated agents would remain. The incident is being investigated, with conflicting accounts from officials and eyewitnesses.

title: 'Energy greed': Venezuela acting prez calls out Trump; leaves door open for Russia, China
content: Venezuela's interim President Delcy Rodriguez has accused the US of using false claims about drugs and human rights as a pretext to seize the nation's oil. She stated Venezuela is open to mutually beneficial energy partnerships with clearly defined commercial contracts. This comes as the US announced it would manage future Venezuelan crude sales and oversee its global petroleum trade.

title: IND vs NZ: Tilak Varma ruled out of first three T20Is; BCCI issues injury update
content: Indian batter Tilak Varma has undergone emergency abdominal surgery in Rajkot and will miss the first three T20Is against New Zealand. The 23-year-old is recovering well and has been discharged from the hospital. His availability for the remaining matches and the T20 World Cup opener remains uncertain as he begins his return-to-training process.

title: Nvidia H200 chips: Company says demand booming; China responds with 'wait, not so fast'
content: China has temporarily halted orders for Nvidia's advanced H200 AI chips, seeking to regulate imports while pushing for domestic semiconductor self-reliance. This move aims to prevent a rush before Beijing finalizes its stance on allowing these powerful processors. Nvidia, meanwhile, is demanding full upfront payment with no refunds, shifting financial risk to buyers amidst this uncertainty.

title: 'Axis of war': Russia warns EU over peacekeeping force in Ukraine; takes shot at US
content: Russia has branded Ukraine and its allies an "axis of war," calling the proposed peacekeeping force deployments plan "dangerous" and "destructive". Moscow warned that any such troops would be considered legitimate military targets. This strong reaction follows new security guarantees announced for Kyiv. Meanwhile, the US seized a Russian-flagged tanker, which Moscow claims will escalate tensions.

title: Ashes: 'Sold a lie for three years' - Boycott rips into England
content: Former England opener Geoffrey Boycott has sharply criticised England after their Ashes defeat, accusing Brendon McCullum, Rob Key and Ben Stokes of promoting a flawed, consequence-free philosophy. Boycott said players lacked accountability despite early success under McCullum-Stokes. Selection issues and injuries hurt England‚Äôs bowling, while Jacob Bethell‚Äôs Sydney hundred showed the promise.

title: More trouble looms for India as Trump greenlights harsher sanctions bill
content: President Trump has greenlit a bipartisan bill authorizing significant sanctions and up to 500% tariffs on countries buying Russian energy. The Sanctioning Russia Act aims to pressure nations like China, India, and Brazil, part of the BRICS block, to cease fueling Russia's war machine.

title: Musk says he's impressed with China; highlights its rapid EV & solar growth
content: Elon Musk humorously noted China's rapid adoption of his energy ideas, from EVs and solar to massive battery production. He highlighted China's dominance in these sectors, contrasting it with US potential. Musk emphasized batteries, like Tesla's Megapacks, as crucial for doubling US energy throughput without new power plants, especially for AI's growing demands.

title: Chanakyaneeti or sidelined: Why is Vance missing from Trump's Venezuela triumph?
content: While Trump‚Äôs inner circle toasted the capture of Nicol√°s Maduro, a spectacle equal parts action movie and reality show, the Vice President was nowhere to be seen. In the impromptu ‚Äúwar room‚Äù where Trump green-lit the raid on Caracas, Vance‚Äôs chair was reportedly empty. And when the administration brass held a press conference to celebrate their ‚Äúperfect‚Äù operation, Vance was again absent, leaving Rubio to play the starring role as the public face of America‚Äôs newest foreign intervention.

title: Russian oil purchase: How 500% tariff could upend India-US trade - explained
content: US President Donald Trump has backed a bill that could levy 500% tariffs on countries buying Russian oil, giving the US leverage over major buyers such as China and India to curb imports from Moscow.

title: Philanthropy push: Jeff Bezos‚Äô ex-wife donates billions to non-profits; biggest giveaway in 2025
content: Mackenzie Scott, ex-wife of Amazon's founder, has significantly reduced her stake in the e-commerce giant, selling shares worth $13 billion.  She continues her massive philanthropic efforts, donating $7.1 billion to non-profits in 2025 alone, including over $1.2 billion to Historically Black Colleges and Universities.  These substantial, unrestricted grants are seen as a counterpoint to tech companies scaling back DEI initiatives.

title: Istanbul storm caught on camera; video shows plane wobbling mid-landing ‚Äî video
content: Istanbul faced a powerful storm with gale-force winds and towering waves, causing widespread disruption. A Pegasus flight aborted landing due to severe weather, while sea transport across western Turkiye, including the Bosphorus and Dardanelles, was heavily impacted. Fallen trees and localized flooding were reported in several provinces.

title: The heat of air conditioners: How climate change is driving up power bills‚Äî a closer look
content: Soaring temperatures are escalating global electricity demand, particularly for cooling, leading to price hikes and straining energy grids. India's consumption is surging, with a heavy reliance on coal exacerbating emissions. While renewable energy is growing, the article highlights the urgent need for cleaner solutions to prevent electricity from fueling the climate crisis it aims to combat.

title: Candace Owens questions Charlie Kirk after sharing unseen image with no blood
content: Candace Owens shared claims about a photo she says shows Charlie Kirk after an alleged shooting. She questioned the official story and named people she said could not be trusted. However, there is no verified evidence, police record, or official confirmation that Charlie Kirk was shot or killed. Her statements remain unproven and widely disputed.

title: Tommy Fleetwood & Clare Fleetwood net worth: Golf earnings, sponsors, family
content: Tommy and Clare Fleetwood have built a significant fortune through Tommy's successful golf career, prize money, and lucrative brand deals. Clare, as his manager, plays a crucial role in their financial success and their private family life. Their collaborative approach has led to both on-course achievements and long-term financial stability.

title: Travis Kelce hits breaking point as Taylor Swift reaches new career high
content: As the Chiefs wrapped up a disappointing season, Travis Kelce faced mounting questions about his NFL future and the possibility of retirement. At the same time, Taylor Swift reached another career high, extending her historic run atop the Billboard 200. The contrast highlighted a pivotal moment for the high-profile couple, with one career pausing as the other surged forward.

title: 'Economic blockade': Kerala CM targets Centre; calls for satyagraha on Jan 12
content: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan has accused the Centre of a "financial stranglehold" and announced a satyagraha protest on January 12 against an alleged "economic blockade." He also criticised Congress, saying that "the party, which claims to be the principal opposition party of the country, is also moving along the same path" as the central govt.

title: Ruturaj creates history: Cricketer breaks multiple records; surpasses Kohli and Babar
content: Ruturaj Gaikwad smashed a brilliant 134 in the Vijay Hazare Trophy, reaching his 20th List A century in a record 95 innings. He also became the fastest to 5,000 List A runs. Despite stellar domestic form and a recent ODI century, Gaikwad's omission from the upcoming India squad raises eyebrows. He will lead CSK in IPL 2026.

title: 'Donroe' doctrine: 5 reasons why Trump's Maduro shock was not about oil. It was a msg for Xi
content: The US seizure of Nicolas Maduro and control over Venezuela's oil marks a significant blow to China's influence in Latin America. This move, rerouting billions in crude to the US, undermines Beijing's decade-long economic diplomacy and its strategy of championing sovereignty. It signals that economic ties don't guarantee protection against US military power.

title: Delhi‚Äôs private schools can‚Äôt shake off fee committees: HC extends deadlines, autonomy under challenge
content: Fee regulation committees will move forward in Delhi‚Äôs private schools‚Äîfor now. The High Court declined to stay the government notification but extended deadlines for setting up committees and submitting proposed fee structures. The petitioners argue the 2025 law is unconstitutional and creates overlapping controls with the 1973 Act. Schools call it intrusive as the dispute now heads to further hearings‚Äîand may travel beyond the High Court.

title: Hindu man lynched in Bangladesh: Main accused held; 21 arrested so far
content: Police arrested Yasin Arafat, the main suspect in the murder of Hindu worker Dipu Chandra Das. Arafat, a former madrasa teacher, allegedly led a mob that attacked and killed Das. This incident follows a period of unrest in Bangladesh. Twenty-one people have been arrested in connection with the case. Nine have given confessional statements.

title: Drama at PSL! Ex-franchise owner withdraws: 'South Punjab is where my heart is'
content: Former Multan Sultans owner Ali Khan Tareen has withdrawn from the PSL auction for two new franchises being held in Islamabad. Announcing his decision on X, Tareen said his PSL journey was about representing South Punjab, not business. He plans to watch as a fan this year but hinted at a return if Multan is sold again. Nine bidders remain in the race.

title: AI, IT and yes, booze too: Gujarat‚Äôs big GIFT City push
content: Gujarat is launching a major push into AI and the digital economy with a dedicated IT-AI cluster near GIFT City and the establishment of the Indian AI Research Organisation (IAIRO). These initiatives aim to attract global tech giants, foster innovation, and position the state as a national and global hub for emerging technologies.

title: Exclusive: Why no Hikaru? Inside new FIDE Freestyle Chess World Championship
content: FIDE and Freestyle Chess ended a long-running dispute over world championship authority by agreeing to stage the first official FIDE Freestyle Chess World Championship. The conflict began in late 2024 over title rights, sparking public clashes and player concerns. A renewed dialogue in 2025 led to reconciliation, aligning Freestyle‚Äôs tour with FIDE governance and creating a unified championship framework.

title: Explained: Will Venezuelan crude lead to cheap petrol for American consumers?
content: The timing matters. Oil prices are already under pressure globally, and petrol prices have eased after years of inflation-driven pain. The Venezuela pitch is being sold as a way to lock that relief in.

title: Did Sidda celebrate record of longest-serving CM prematurely?
content: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah's supporters celebrated a 'country chicken feast' for his tenure, though the official record as longest-serving CM is days away. Political analysts questioned the premature fanfare amidst speculation about leadership changes.  Siddaramaiah, however, highlighted his government's achievements and dismissed opposition criticism.

title: US consulate issues fresh warning to B1/B2 visa holders ‚Äî what is it?
content: The US Consulate General in Mumbai has issued a warning to B1/B2 visitor visa holders regarding unauthorized employment. Engaging in work activities not permitted by the visa can lead to deportation and a potential lifetime ban from entering the United States. Travelers are advised to understand visa regulations before planning their trips.

title: ‚ÄòBramayugam‚Äô: Mammootty film enters Oscar Academy space
content: Mammootty's film 'Bramayugam' is set for a prestigious screening at the Academy Museum of Motion Pictures in Los Angeles on February 12, 2026. This marks the first time a Mammootty-starrer will be shown at the museum, as part of the 'Where the Forest Meets the Sea' folk horror series.

title: VHT: Sarfaraz scripts history; smokes 30 off Abhishek to record fastest-ever fifty
content: Sarfaraz Khan smashed the fastest fifty in Vijay Hazare Trophy history. His explosive 62 off 20 balls was a highlight. Mumbai narrowly lost to Punjab by one run. Punjab finished top of Group C. Both teams qualified for the quarter-finals.

title: 'CM's aides removed evidence': ED's big charge against Mamata; I-PAC raids trigger row
content: The Enforcement Directorate accused West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee of obstructing a money-laundering probe into a coal smuggling syndicate. The ED claims Banerjee, accompanied by police, entered a residence and I-PAC office, seizing documents and electronic devices. Banerjee rejected the allegations, calling the searches politically motivated and an attempt to seize TMC's election strategy.

title: How ICE shot a mother in cold blood - and Trump defended it
content: Family members and neighbours told local reporters that she was not participating in protests or attempting to interfere with law enforcement on the day of the shooting. She was described as someone who had recently been navigating significant personal change, including the loss of her former spouse, while focusing on caring for her children and settling into daily life in the city.

title: More degrees, fewer jobs: Why India‚Äôs educated women are still shut out of the workforce
content: India‚Äôs rising female enrolment in higher education masks a deeper economic failure. Despite earning degrees in record numbers, only about one-third of Indian women are considered employable, according to TeamLease data. Sectoral barriers, persistent pay gaps, and weak career pipelines continue to push women out of the workforce, turning educational gains into stalled economic progress.

title: 'Slow down? That‚Äôs not fast bowling': The belief that shaped Mitchell Starc
content: Mitchell Starc‚Äôs Ashes heroics capped a series that underlined both his durability and evolution. As the left-armer moves closer to the game‚Äôs all-time highest wicket-takers, his childhood coach Neil de Costa recalls the defining philosophy that shaped Starc‚Äôs career: bowl fast, swing hard and ignore anyone who tells you otherwise.

title: JEE Main 2026 exam dates revised: Check complete schedule here
content: The National Testing Agency has revised the JEE Main 2026 Session 1 schedule, with exams now set from January 21 to January 29 instead of January 30. The exam city slip has been released on the official website. Admit cards are expected in the second week of January, while Paper 1 and Paper 2 exams will be held in multiple shifts.

title: Big surprise in Maharashtra civic polls: 12 suspended Congress corporators join BJP
content: Twelve Congress corporators and a former Block President, suspended for aligning with the BJP in Ambernath Municipal Council, have officially joined the Bharatiya Janata Party. State BJP President Ravindra Chavan welcomed them, citing their commitment to city development as the reason for induction. This move follows a controversial local alliance that aimed to foster civic governance and development in Ambernath.

title: New labour codes: What they mean for employees? Salary & benefits rules explained
content: New Labour Codes explained: The draft rules released by the government are important because they outline several key provisions on how employees' wages, salary, allowances and gratuity benefits are structured.

title: The quiet unease beneath an AI-led hiring boom: Why 80% of people feel unprepared for work in 2026
content: A new LinkedIn report reveals a 2026 job market marked by uncertainty, with 80% of job seekers feeling unprepared and recruiters struggling to find quality talent.  AI is reshaping hiring, making it more data-driven but less transparent.  This creates a confidence gap, as both sides navigate evolving, algorithm-driven processes where visibility depends on machine-readable signals.

title: Hit by Op Sindoor, panic-stricken Pak mounted frantic lobbying in US
content: Following India's military retaliation against a terror attack, Pakistan urgently sought US mediation to halt New Delhi's strikes.  FARA filings reveal Islamabad's frantic lobbying efforts, involving over 60 contacts with US officials and media.  Pakistan's hired firm, Squire Patton Boggs, aimed to secure American intervention to "somehow halt" India's operations, indicating significant behind-the-scenes panic.

title: JEE Main 2026 city intimation slip for Session 1 released at NTA website: Direct link to download here
content: The National Testing Agency (NTA) has released the JEE Main 2026 Session 1 city intimation slip for lakhs of students. This slip informs candidates of their exam city, aiding in advance travel and accommodation planning. It is crucial to note that this is not the admit card, which will be issued separately.

title: Dolphins fire coach McDaniel after 7-10 season
content: The Dolphins have fired coach Mike McDaniel after Miami finished 7-10, its second straight season missing the playoffs.

title: Sources: Bucs fire OC Grizzard, QB coach Lewis
content: Josh Grizzard has been fired by the Buccaneers after only one season as their offensive coordinator, sources told ESPN.

title: Stone-faced Cignetti vows 'I am happy, at times'
content: Curt Cignetti's demeanor during games has made the transformative Hoosiers coach into a meme, but Cignetti says he is having some fun during Indiana's historic rise, just not in front of the camera.

title: Sources: Hawks end Young era, send G to Wiz
content: The Hawks are trading four-time All-Star Trae Young to the Wizards for CJ McCollum and Corey Kispert, sources said.

title: Chiefs 'aware' of abuse allegations by Rice's ex
content: The Chiefs acknowledged Wednesday that they are aware of domestic violence allegations made by a woman who is the ex-girlfriend of Rashee Rice, with the team saying it's in communication with the league and will have no additional comment at this time.

title: Lipsey touted as best PG in nation after ISU win
content: Iowa State coach T.J. Otzelberger declared Tamin Lipsey the nation's best point guard after he led the Cyclones past Baylor and to the first 15-0 start in program history Wednesday night.

title: Spurs' Sochan: 'Polite exchange' with Vanderbilt
content: Spurs forward Jeremy Sochan downplayed the severity of a postgame incident Wednesday that involved Lakers forward Jarred Vanderbilt poking him in the face.

title: Jim Harbaugh hails John, hopes he's NFC-bound
content: Jim Harbaugh doesn't expect his older brother John to be out of a job very long but just hopes his next landing spot isn't in the AFC, where the Chargers reside. "As I told him, whatever team he goes to is going to be formidable," Jim said.

title: HOF goalie Hall, who started 502 in a row, dies
content: Glenn Hall, a Hockey Hall of Famer whose streak of 502 consecutive starts as a goaltender remains an NHL record, has died. He was 94.

title: üèÄ Six NBA trade offers to reshape playoff chase
content: Let's help Milwaukee build around Giannis, the Lakers and the Timberwolves fill major needs, and Golden State end its long saga.

title: 'What if we are the people who win these games?' A new feeling at Ole Miss
content: After a chaotic month, Ole Miss won the kind of game it always loses, leaving its fans wondering how far it can go.

title: Barnwell predicts the NFL playoff bracket: Could two lower seeds go to the Super Bowl?
content: Four road teams winning in the wild-card round -- and two of them making it all the way to the Super Bowl? Let's project the full playoffs.

title: Grading the Trae Young trade: How did the Hawks and Wizards fare?
content: Trae Young is headed from the Hawks to the Wizards for CJ McCollum and Corey Kispert. Which team fared best? We graded the trade.

title: Live trade tracker: Details for every deal of the 2025-26 season
content: Here's every trade of this regular season, starting with the Hawks dealing away franchise star Trae Young.

title: MLB midwinter Power Rankings: Where every team stands in the new year
content: Though there are still free agents to be signed, let's reassess the standings now that we're midway through the offseason.

title: The bizarre world of arbitration -- and the ace whose record raise could rock the system
content: Baseball's unique offseason contract process is built on comps. Enter the pitcher who is beyond comparison.

title: Browns locked in for 'next 120 days': Coach, draft and a QB
content: Are Cleveland's owners letting a 5-12 season weigh them down? Not a chance. They're pressing forward.

title: 'Even if it's not safe, I still want to play': What NHL players, owners, execs are saying about Olympic ice
content: While the rink won't be perfect, there's also an overwhelming sentiment shared by all stakeholders: The men's Olympic hockey tournament will go on.

title: Connelly breaks down Miami-Ole Miss, Oregon-Indiana
content: Our deep dive into the semifinals dissects the matchups that will determine who moves on to the title game.

title: Power Rankings: Unbeaten Vanderbilt, Nebraska crack top 10
content: The Commodores and Cornhuskers have outperformed preseason expectations, headlining this week's biggest risers.

title: Power Rankings: Who is really the top team in the Big 12?
content: Texas Tech, one of four unbeaten teams left in women's D-I, and Baylor enter the top 16 as UNC and Notre Dame exit.

title: Must-see FA Cup games: Wrexham take on Premier League side, Rosenior's Chelsea debut
content: Which FA Cup hopefuls are primed for an upset? Can Liam Rosenior win his first match as Chelsea manager? Here are eight can't-miss matches.

title: VAR review: Did Chelsea get away with what should've been a penalty for Fulham?
content: Chelsea could have given up a penalty to Fulham, but the VAR stuck with the on-field decision. Was it the right call?

title: Secret sauce to Bills beating the Jaguars? A big key is the O-line
content: What makes up the Bills O-line unit's success and its diverse personalities off the field? Let them explain.

title: Best way to an Eagles defensive lineman's heart -- and performance? Meatballs
content: Vic Fangio introduced the Meatball Award this season for his defense to serve as that extra bit of motivation.

title: Mendoza vs. Moore: Why the CFP semifinals will have a big impact on the NFL draft
content: New York Jets GM Darren Mougey will be heavily evaluating quarterbacks in the college playoffs ahead of the draft.

title: Roster overhaul, six pillars and the Pittsburgh Steelers: Inside the Kings' latest revamp
content: The Kings fired Mike Brown this time last season, but one year later don't seem any closer to finding their way.

title: How Trevor Lawrence's grill gift was kept a surprise -- and came together
content: The quarterback's grill came from a collaboration of his mom, wife, former Clemson teammate and the Jaguars social media team.

title: Newest layer in the Packers-Bears rivalry? Cheese grater hats
content: DJ Moore's celebration helped turn a foam cheese grater hat into the latest Bears-Packers rivalry fixture.

title: Flex and superflex rankings for 2026
content: An early look at the top 200 QBs, RBs, WRs and TEs for 2026 drafts, updated throughout the fantasy football offseason.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Karl to commit to Bayern after Real Madrid comments
content: Bayern Munich's teenage star Lennart Karl recently courted interest from Real Madrid but is ready to commit his long-term future to the club. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: Men's hockey check-in: Which teams are poised for a Frozen Four run?
content: A look at the top storylines, players to watch and Frozen Four picks as we hit the season's second half.

title: Pound-for-pound rankings: Fundora moves up; a new name in the top 10
content: Gabriela Fundora keeps moving up and Elif Nur Turhan scored another impressive TKO victory. Here's the latest women's pound-for-pound rankings.

title: Knueppel, Adebayo headline biggest surprises and disappointments
content: Our panel of fantasy basketball experts lists their biggest surprises and disappointments so far this season.

title: Ranking the top American tennis players as 2026 begins
content: Coco Gauff won another major title in 2025, and Taylor Fritz continued to lead the American men. But who else is set to make a move in 2026?

content: the TOI Business Desk is a vigilant and dedicated team of journalists committed to delivering the latest and most relevant business news from around the world to readers of the Times of India . the desk ensures that TOI readers are well-informed about the ever-changing and dynamic world of commerce .

title: 'Naya Hindustan': The 'Angry Young Man' is back, but has his rage changed sides?
content: 'Yeh police station hai, tumhare baap ka ghar nahi' is back in cinema, louder, bloodier and far more profitable . the return of angry young men on screen is no longer a creative coincidence .

title: 6 Accused In Manipur Gang-Rape Case Charged By Special CBI Court
content: A special CBI court in Guwahati has framed charges against six accused in the case where three women were stripped naked and two of them allegedly gang-raped during ethnic clashes in Manipur in May 2023.

title: Between Akal Takht And The Ballot Box: Punjab's Politics Of Belief
content: Punjab's uneasy relationship between faith and state power is once again in sharp focus, with Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann being summoned by the Sri Akal Takht Sahib over alleged "anti-Sikh" remarks.

title: "Mamata Banerjee Obstructed Probe": Probe Agency Approaches High Court
content: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee has walked out with a laptop, phone and multiple documents from the house of Prateek Jain, the chief of election consultant IPAC, during a raid by the Enforcement Directorate, the central agency has alleged.

title: "Documents Stolen": I-PAC Head's Family's Big Charge Against Probe Agency ED
content: The family of Pratik Jain, chief of political consultancy firm I-PAC, has filed a complaint with the police against the Enforcement Directorate, alleging theft of important documents during searches at their home that took place today.

title: 'Will Shoot First, Ask Questions Later': Denmark Warns US Over Greenland Invasion
content: The Danish defence ministry said that soldiers will be required to shoot first and ask questions later if the United States invades Greenland.

title: "She Behaved Horribly": Trump Defends Immigration Officer Who Shot Woman
content: Just hours after an Immigration and Customs Enforcement officer shot and killed a 37-year-old woman in Minneapolis on Wednesday, US President Donald Trump told reporters that the woman was responsible because she had tried to "run over" the officer.

title: "Temporary Voters" From Other States In Assam Draft Poll Rolls, Alleges Congress
content: The Assam Congress has expressed alarm over the alleged inclusion of "temporary voters" from other states in the draft electoral rolls, published after a Special Revision (SR) of the voter lists.

title: Stray Dog Control Can Cost Up To Rs 27,000 Crore, Supreme Court Told
content: Removing stray dogs from public spaces can cost the government up to Rs 26,800 crore, the Supreme Court was told today.

title: Vehicle-To-Vehicle System In India Soon: What It Means for Drivers
content: The Government of India is preparing to roll out Vehicle-to-Vehicle (V2V) communication technology by end of 2026.

title: Newly Installed Speed Breakers Worth Rs 8 Lakh Stolen In Madhya Pradesh
content: In a bizarre theft incident in Madhya Pradesh's Vidisha district, thieves stole several speed breakers installed on city roads to control traffic speed.

title: Chhattisgarh Exam Question On Dog's Name With Ram As Option Sparks Outrage
content: A multiple choice question on the name of a dog in an English test paper in government schools in Chhattisgarh's Mahasamund district has triggered controversy and protests after 'Ram' was listed as one of the options.

title: Himachal High Court Receives Bomb Threat Email, Security Heightened
content: A search operation was conducted in the Himachal Pradesh High Court on Thursday after a bomb threat was received through an e-mail by court authorities, officials said.

title: Russia-Bound Oil Tanker Hit By Drone In Black Sea, Diverts To Turkey: Report
content: Russia-bound oil tanker suffered a drone attack in the Black Sea that prompted it to request Turkish coastguard assistance and divert from its course, according to a notice by Lloyd's List Intelligence and a separate maritime security source.

title: E Coli Detected In Bhopal Water After 20 Die In Indore Contamination
content: Groundwater in several parts of Bhopal, including Khanugaon, Adampur Cantonment, and Vajpayee Nagar, has tested positive for E coli bacteria.

title: 'It Was Always About Oil': Venezuela's Leader Slams "Energy Greed" Of US
content: Venezuela's interim president, Delcy Rodriguez, said that the US allegations related to narcotics trafficking, democracy, and human rights were "falsehoods" and that "energy greed" was the real motivation behind the external pressure.

title: 'Democracy On Sale': BJP Slams Congress' Rs 50,000 Ticket Fee For Assam Polls
content: A major political controversy erupted in Assam on Thursday over the Congress party's decision to require ticket aspirants for this year's Assam polls to pay Rs 50,000 while giving their party ticket application forms

title: BMW's 2026 India Plan: 10 New Cars, 17 Upgrades, And More Local Sourcing
content: BMW will launch 10 new cars in India this year, including EVs and its popular MINI brand, while boosting local sourcing to lower costs as luxury car sales in the country remain stubbornly small, its India CEO told Reuters.

title: Global Cooperation Is Changing, Not Declining: World Economic Forum
content: The Global Cooperation Barometer 2026 shows that countries and companies are working together in new ways, with more regional, smaller and flexible partnerships.

title: Odisha Man Stripped, Beaten, Paraded In Public Over Relationship With Minor
content: A man was stripped naked, tied up, brutally beaten up by a mob and paraded through the streets in Odisha's Mayurbhanj district on allegations of a relationship with a minor girl.

title: 'Campaigned For PM Modi Twice, He Broke My Party': Uddhav Thackeray
content: Shiv Sena (UBT) chief Uddhav Thackeray on Thursday said that he had campaigned to make Narendra Modi the prime minister in 2014 and 2019, but the latter is out to destroy his party.

title: College football transfer portal: Tracking who's on the move
content: Max Olson ranks Cincinnati's Brendan Sorsby as the top player in the transfer portal and predicts a recruitment battle between Texas Tech and LSU. (1:04) College football's transfer portal officially opened at midnight ET on Jan. 2. However, players have been announcing their intentions to transfer since the regular season ended. By midday on Day 1, more than 4,500 Division I college football players have entered the transfer portal. Players now have until Jan. 16 to enter their name to transfer. It doesn't mean they have to find their new schools by then -- or that they can't return to their previous schools. We are tracking the notable players entering the portal as well as those players who will re-sign with their current schools. Here's the latest news and updates on how the 2026 season could be transformed.

title: AJ Dybantsa, more freshmen headline men's Wooden Award midseason top 25
content: cam Boozer leads the nation in scoring at 23.3 points per game . the 6-foot-9 forward is also averaging 9.7 rebounds and 4.2 assists . AJ Dybantsa recently put together one of the most impressive stretches ever by a freshman .

title: NBA Power Rankings: Where Mavs, Hawks and others stack up ahead of trade deadline
content: there is less than one month until the 2026 trade deadline . the two teams are open to trade talks . it's yet to be seen how the trade deadline will impact the standings . both the Detroit Pistons and Oklahoma City Thunder stand firmly at the top of their conferences .

title: Fudd, Strong headline women's Wooden Award midseason top 25
content: the wooden award is given to the most outstanding player in college basketball . azzi Fudd and Sarah Strong also return to the top-25 list . other notable inclusions include the likes of miLaysia Fulwiley, flau'jae Johnson and mikaylah Williams .

title: 'This is one of the big moments in college football': Demond Williams Jr.'s case tests whether contracts can be enforced
content: demond Williams Jr. signed a contract to return to the u.s. four days earlier . he'd signed the contract, which was set to pay him in the mid-$4 million range . "this is a very bright line," a college official says .

title: Is parity in the Premier League a sign of quality -- or do these teams just stink?
content: Nicol and Laurens talk about why Thomas Tuchel could be the best coach available to take over . Nicol: "you were sluggish, didn't have work, and you do like soccer" chelsea, liverpool, manchester city, arsenal and manchester united all scored in the premier league .

title: Why these semifinals are just what college football needed
content: new bloods will replace blue bloods on college football's biggest postseason stage . julian zelizer: it's a basketball school that is leading the movement . she says if the Hurricanes win a national championship, they'll be able to win .

title: Farm managers? How Chelsea hire of Liam Rosenior could change soccer
content: inexperienced Liam Rosenior has taken charge at the club . the blues have appointed from within, turning to the manager of their partner club, Strasbourg . there are now over 100 multi-club organizations (MCOs) in the premier league .

title: Offseason guide for eliminated NFL teams: Key free agents, draft outlook and predictions
content: the 2026 offseason has begun for the 18 teams that did not make the postseason . we have next steps for all 18 franchises . what big decisions are on deck for each front office? we have a big offseason prediction for every eliminated team .

title: Wait, the Ravens moved on from Harbaugh?! Answering seven questions about the move
content: the Baltimore Ravens are looking for a new head coach after the move . owner Steve Bisciotti said he was searching for the next coach . the manager was fired after guiding the Ravens to a Super Bowl title in 2012 .

title: 'Always a race': How Rueben Bain Jr., Akheem Mesidor have driven Miami and each other
content: the biggest debate is which one of them is going to get to the QB first . the best pair of edge rushers in college football ranked the No. 2 (Bain) and No. 3 (Mesidor) defensive ends in Mel Kiper Jr.'s 2026 draft rankings .

title: Facing the Texans this postseason? Broncos? Seahawks? Solak on the three elite defenses
content: offensive teams generally win championships . defense wins championships, balancing teams wins championship . thomas mccarthy: if we're forced to split the hair between the two sides of the ball, we'll see more below-average teams .

title: One big thing we're hearing on every NFL team's coaching situation: Hot seats, candidates, more
content: the Raiders are in position to hunt for a big-name defensive coordinator after firing Matt Eberflus . we're also keeping an eye on coach movement . how did the coach split go down? what are the coaches thinking after securing the no. 1 pick .

title: India and Iran to start diplomatic calendar for 75th anniversary of bilateral ties
content: The celebration of bilateral ties will begin with the visit of Iran Foreign Minister Syed Abbas Araghchi that is expected later this month

title: Watch: Demolition drive around Faiz-e-Ilahi Mosque in Delhi triggers clashes | Ground Report
content: A late-night demolition to remove encroachments around the Faiz-e-Ilahi Mosque at Turkman Gate, carried out on Delhi High Court directions, led to stone-pelting, injuries to police personnel and multiple arrests.

title: Increased money in politics and drugs on the streets needs to be analysed: Raj Thackeray
content: In an interview with a regional channel, Thackeray cousins Uddhav and Raj said that the people were being neglected, and power was being misused. They highlighted their agenda over how the Marathi Manoos have been exploited and betrayed, and how migration has taken away the rights of locals

title: Amid Kogilu row, BDA takes up demolition near Thanisandra without notices; Commissioner orders probe
content: While BDA maintains that 13 houses are demolished, residents say that more than 20 houses are affected; Many of the displaced families were tenants who had been living in the area for nearly five years

title: PM Modi to visit Somnath Temple on January 11, hold yatra
content: Prime Minister¬†Narendra Modi recalled his earlier visits to Somnath Temple and spoke about the resilience of faith despite repeated attacks on the shrine by invaders

title: Mamata to protest in Kolkata against ED raids on IPAC office
content: The Trinamool chief says the raids are ‚Äúpolitically motivated to steal party data‚Äù, including candidate list for the upcoming elections

title: BJP stages protest for second day over police ‚Äòdisrobing‚Äô woman during arrest
content: After their protest till late evening in Hubballi on Wednesday, the BJP workers staged another protest on Thursday, this time in Dharwad

title: DGP, CoP must explain inaction against those who used filthy language in the presence of retired judge: HC
content: Justices G. Jayachandran and K. Kumaresh Babu call for an explanation after former judge V. Parthiban writes to the court narrating the incident

title: Denmark explores collaboration with Kudumbashree in the field of elderly care
content: The discussions centered on training Kudumbashree workers to serve as social healthcare helpers in Denmark, building on the success of the K for Care project, which has already trained over a thousand caregivers in Kerala.¬†The move requires more extensive training and Danish language studies.

title: Cabinet gives nod for setting up AP Logistics Infrastructure Corporation, AP Logistics Fund
content: Among others, it clears the proposal to bear the burden of true-up electricity charges by repaying¬†to the DISCOMs in six monthly instalments

title: Greater Noida residents seek pipeline audit after suspected water contamination
content: Residents said they had raised repeated complaints with GNIDA for several months, but alleged that the problem persisted with over 15 locals falling ill in the past several days

title: Jagan making frantic efforts to stay relevant, says Health Minister Satya Kumar
content: The YSRCP government took up several projects without permission, which were later halted by the National Green Tribunal, says the Minister

title: NITI Aayog recognises Kerala‚Äôs LIFE Mission as best model for affordable housing
content: In a recent report, NITI Aayog describes LIFE Mission as a ‚Äòmulti-faceted convergence and community-based model,‚Äô noting that it effectively brings together resources of various departments and local self-government institutions to address the housing needs of the poor

title: Pedamadduru farmers give away 313 acres within an hour of launching LPS
content: Amaravati will be developed strictly in accordance with the Green Tribunal permissions, says Minister Narayana, reiterating that the government will fulfil every promise made to the farmers

title: Kerala government issues guidelines for antibiotic-smart certification of hospitals, LSGs
content: Move as part of government‚Äôs initiative to tackle antimicrobial resistance. Innovative accreditation system has been developed by identifying key performance indicators and giving weightages to each to arrive at a performance score for certification

title: Situation in State-run universities in Tamil Nadu worrisome: Governor Ravi
content: Several institutions from Tamil Nadu had figured in the top 20 NIRF rankings, but there were hardly any State-run institutions on the list, he says

title: J.B. Koshy Commission‚Äôs recommendations are being implemented: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan
content: The panel was formed to study the educational, economic, and welfare issues facing Christian minorities. Since the commission submitted its report in May 2023, 17 departments have implemented 220 of the 284 recommendations and sub-recommendations.

title: Suspected hashish oil seized from Kannur Central Jail inmate
content: The contraband stored in two small bottles, recovered from a convict; Kannur Town police register case

title: NHRC issues notice to Gujarat government over surge in the typhoid cases in Gandhinagar
content: A total of 70 active typhoid cases is concentrated in a particular area of the city, exposing serious flaws in the newly laid water supply system in Gandhinagar City

title: Court proceedings halted in Idukki after a hoax bomb threat
content: The threat was sent to the District Judge‚Äôs official email address under the name of a ‚ÄúTamil Liberation‚Äù organisation

title: Big plans to develop tourism in Andhra Pradesh
content: APTDC signs MoUs worth ‚Çπ19,000 crore, renames Haritha Hotels as ‚ÄòHaritha Punnami‚Äô, and enhances accident insurance coverage for all employees from ‚Çπ5 lakh to ‚Çπ10 lakh, says official

title: Authorities hid my video messages for peace, malice coloured the detention: Wangchuk tells SC
content: Local authorities failed to hand over Mr. Wangchuk‚Äôs video messages and social media posts to the detaining authority, says lawyer; complete reasons for detention only shared after a ‚Äúflagrant delay‚Äù of 28 days

title: Pinarayi defends Balan‚Äôs comment on JIH‚Äôs growing heft in UDF
content: Chief Minister seeks to give the contentious comment a contemporary political context, stating that Balan only held a mirror up to the Islamist organisation‚Äôs increasingly pernicious influence within the Opposition United Democratic Front¬†

title: Watch: Bengaluru school installs bio-toilets on buses to beat traffic stress
content: A private school in Bengaluru has installed bio-toilets on its buses to help students stuck in the city‚Äôs severe traffic congestion. The India-first initiative was launched after parents and students raised concerns over long and stressful daily commutes.

title: One killed as vehicles carrying Sabarimala pilgrims collide head on
content: The accident occurred in Ranni when a Karnataka-registered car carrying four Ayyappa devotees rammed into a mini bus that had arrived from Pathanamthitta

title: Kerala Sangeetha Nataka Akademi unveils logo of ITFoK 2026
content: Festival to be held from January 25 to February 1; nine international productions to echo ‚ÄúVoices in the Silence‚Äù

title: Justice Manoj Kumar Gupta appointed Chief Justice of Uttarakhand HC
content: Justice Manoj Kumar Gupta will assume charge after the incumbent, Justice Guhanathan Narendar, demits office on Jan. 9 upon attaining the age of 62

title: R. Usha takes over as SPMVV Registrar
content: She joined the varsity as a lecturer in 2001, became an associate professor in 2006, and has been serving as a professor since 2013

title: Heavy rush at Sabarimala ahead of Makaravilakku
content: On Thursday, the queue of pilgrims waiting to climb the ‚Äò18 holy steps‚Äô stretches up to Sabaripeedam, prompting the police to temporarily halt the movement of pilgrims at Pampa

title: CBI arrests telecom official over alleged illegal sale of SIM cards for cybercrime
content: The official, serving as area sales manager, was allegedly involved in facilitating the fraudulent issuance of bulk SIM cards in violation of Department of Telecom rules

title: Jagan warns of launching stir for Rayalaseema Lift Irrigation scheme
content: Accusing Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu of placing personal interests above State‚Äôs welfare, the YSRCP chief vows to complete the project at ‚Äòlightning speed‚Äô on coming to power

title: Kaveri 2.0 autofilling property details from e-khatas, builders claim ECs having incomplete details
content: Builders claim the name of the project, carpet area, tower number, block number are not being reflected properly in Encumbrance Certificates

title: RSP faces internal backlash over Eravipuram Assembly seat
content: While a section of the party has proposed fielding Karthik Premachandran, son of Kollam MP N.K. Premachandran, the move has ignited sharp resistance from members who decry the rise of ‚Äòdynasty politics‚Äô.

title: Protest mounts against Poovaranthode hydel project over blasting damage
content: Extensive rock blasting for the project has caused serious structural damage to nearby houses, rendering several of them uninhabitable, say protesters

title: Congress rejigs strategy in Palakkad district, pushes for Thankappan, Balram
content: The Congress is reportedly unhappy with the proposal to cede the Pattambi seat to the Indian Union Muslim League

title: Idukki became an epicentre of protests after Gadgil report
content: Protests erupted after  Gadgil committee recommended that 37% of the Western Ghats be declared eco-sensitive. Of the 123 villages identified as ESAs, 48 were located in Idukki district. Residents were apprehensive that these recommendations would lead to forced evictions and conversion of farmland into protected forest

title: Senior citizen loses ‚Çπ26.52 lakh to online fraudsters; FIR registered
